author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he intends to speak to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi “in the coming weeks” and expressed optimism the two leaders would be able to reach an agreement to resolve a blistering trade fight.
title: Trump Says He’ll Speak to Modi in ‘Coming Weeks’ on Trade

author: Lucy White
description: UK Business Secretary Peter Kyle is set to push China for greater market access to British businesses, as he attends the first high-level trade discussions between the two countries since 2018.
title: UK Seeks Greater Business Access in China as Kyle Resumes Talks

author: Joe Mayes
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has strengthened his oversight of Britain’s economic policy by forming a new board of key figures from 10 Downing Street and the Treasury, tasked with boosting growth and maintaining relations with business ahead of a crunch budget in the autumn.
title: Starmer Increases Oversight of UK Economic Policy With New Board

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Alberto Nardelli
description: President Donald Trump told European officials he’s willing to impose sweeping new tariffs on India and China to push President Vladimir Putin to the negotiating table with Ukraine — but only if EU nations do so as well.
title: Trump Floats New Tariffs on China, India to Squeeze Russia

author: K Oanh Ha, Yang Yang, Naomi Ng
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how a chummy moment between Xi, Putin and Modi at a summit signaled a shift in global power dynamics and what that means for Trump.
title: How a Xi-Putin-Modi Alliance Could Reshape Global Politics

author: Amanda L Gordon, Nacha Cattan, Laura Nahmias
description: Former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo shrugged off concern over a crowded race for New York City mayor, saying there are only two viable candidates in the four-person field.
title: Cuomo Sees Two-Person Mayor’s Race as Business Leaders Hear Plan

author: Molly Smith
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy editor Molly Smith looks  at the major revision to the government’s numbers on job growth. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Sees Vindication in Record Revision to Jobs Numbers

author: Greg Ryan
description: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey, who’s up for reelection next year in a state reeling from soaring home prices, is looking to jump-start housing construction by slashing environmental reviews.
title: Massachusetts Wants to Ease Environmental Rules to Boost Housing

author: Edward Bolingbroke, Michael MacKenzie
description: Investors are leaning into bullish bets on US Treasuries ahead of this week’s inflation report, as a recent run of softer-than-expected data opens the door for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in September and further ease monetary policy in the months ahead.
title: Treasury Investors Ramp Up Bullish Positions Ahead of CPI Data

author: Mark Chediak
description: Developers of large solar farms said the Trump administration has stopped moving forward on approvals for projects that impact federal land, potentially leading to costly delays.
title: Big Solar Developers See Delays in US Project Approvals

author: Zoe Tillman
description: US Chief Justice John Roberts will allow the Trump administration to resume a partial freeze on foreign assistance funding for now, a move that opponents say heightens the risk that at least some of the billions of dollars at stake will expire at the end of the month.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Keep Partial Aid Freeze for Now

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Paul Wallace, Alisa Odenheimer
description: President Donald Trump made a rare public break with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, saying the leader’s decision to launch a unilateral attack against Hamas in Qatar “does not advance Israel or America’s goals.”
title: Israel Attacks Hamas in Doha, Drawing Rare Rebuke From US

author: Jeremy Hill
description: Flagstar Financial Inc. Chief Executive Officer Joseph Otting is preparing for Zohran Mamdani’s New York City.
title: Flagstar CEO Otting Says NYC Banks Must Face Mamdani Reality

author: Georgia Hall, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Eidelson
description: Governors in the US Northeast are considering dropping resistance to natural gas pipelines and other fossil fuel projects in the hopes they can convince President Donald Trump to allow offshore wind farms to move forward.
title: Northeast Governors Accept Fossil Fuel Future to Save Wind Farms

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Kristina Peterson
description: President Donald Trump’s official health policy roadmap steers clear of new crackdowns on the food and agriculture industries that have been frequently blamed by top officials for a rise in chronic diseases.
title: Trump Health Report Avoids New Crackdowns on Food, Agriculture

author: William Horobin
description: The French economy is on track to keep growing at 0.3% in the third quarter even as business leaders flag rising uncertainty over a volatile political situation, the country’s central bank said.
title: Bank of France Sees Sustained Growth Despite Political Headwinds

author: Neil Munshi, Peter Martin, Fiona MacDonald
description: Israel’s unprecedented strike on Qatar’s capital on Tuesday delivered a major blow to US-supported efforts to normalize ties with Gulf Arab nations and possibly crippled talks for a ceasefire in Gaza.
title: Israeli Strike on Qatar Upends Gaza Truce Talks, Gulf Arab Ties

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Paul Wallace, Alisa Odenheimer
description: Israel’s unilateral attack on Hamas in Qatar did not advance Israeli or American goals in trying to bring an end to the Middle East conflict, the White House said.
title: Attack in Doha Didn’t Aid US and Israeli Goals, White House Says

author: Emily Birnbaum, Oma Seddiq
description: A key Republican senator is pressing to waive federal regulations for artificial intelligence companies while they test and develop their products, according to a draft of the bill viewed by Bloomberg News.
title: Draft Senate Bill Waives Federal Rules on AI Companies During Testing

author: Samy Adghirni, James Regan
description: President Emmanuel Macron named Sebastien Lecornu to be France’s new prime minister, tapping a longtime ally to pick up the mantle of trying to pass a budget through a divided parliament.
title: Macron Appoints Ally Lecornu as France’s New Prime Minister

author: Ivana Bargues, Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s finance chief expressed confidence that his government can stay in the good graces of both the US and China as the Andean nation aims to further grow its foreign trade and benefit from higher export prices.
title: Peru Bets It Can Navigate US-China Tensions, Grow Export Markets

author: Rodrigo Orihuela, Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain’s top prosecutor will be put on trial, an unusual move that adds to growing tensions between Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez and the country’s judges.
title: Spain’s Top Prosecutor to Face Trial Over Political Scandal

author: Janet Lorin
description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology said it’s preparing for “significant new financial pressures,” including an increased tax on its endowment and uncertainty about federal science funding under President Donald Trump.
title: MIT Sees ‘Significant New Financial Pressures’ From Trump Cuts

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer stood by Britain’s ambassador to the US, Peter Mandelson, after newly released files revealed he had called the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein his “best pal.”
title: Starmer Defends US Envoy Mandelson Over Friendly Note to Epstein

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump called a birthday note he allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein a “dead issue,” seeking to tamp down questions over his past interactions with the late disgraced financier.
title: Trump Calls Epstein Letter a ‘Dead Issue’ in NBC News Interview

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Trump administration offered $4.7 million to El Salvador to imprison deported Venezuelan migrants earlier this year, but restricted the money from being used in ways that conflict with President Donald Trump’s policies on immigration, diversity and abortion, according to a newly disclosed copy of the March agreement.
title: US-El Salvador Prison Agreement Included Anti-DEI, Asylum Terms

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres decried the rise in global military spending to a record high, saying that priorities like child malnutrition, poverty and climate change were being neglected.
title: UN Blasts Global Military Spending Escalation

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Mali carried out military strikes in the southwest of the country, where Al-Qaeda-linked groups have imposed a fuel embargo that threatens to reduce supplies in the capital and disrupt trade with neighboring countries.
title: Malian Army Offensive Targets Region Hit by Jihadist Blockade

author: Fernando Travaglini
description: Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes rejected procedural claims made by Jair Bolsonaro’s defense team as the former president’s trial on coup attempt charges resumed, pushing back on arguments that they have not had sufficient access to evidence.
title: Bolsonaro’s Defense Claims Overruled as Brazil Coup Trial Continues

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: South Africa is on the verge of appointing a new ambassador to the US — a post that has stood vacant for months during which President Donald Trump has criticized Pretoria’s Black empowerment and foreign policies, and imposed punitive tariffs on its imports.
title: South Africa Set to Name New Ambassador to US to Ease Tension

description: Smoke rises from an explosion in Doha on Sept. 9. Source: AP Photo
title: Israel Targets Hamas With Strike in Qatar

author: Samy Adghirni, William Horobin
description: Francois Bayrou resigned as France’s prime minister Tuesday, putting the onus on President Emmanuel Macron to quickly name a new premier who can stabilize the country’s urgent fiscal situation.
title: France’s Premier Resigns as Macron Considers Replacement

author: Daniele Lepido, Donato Paolo Mancini, Josh Wingrove
description: The US has stepped up pressure on Italy over Pirelli & C. SpA, warning that the presence of a Chinese state-owned company as the tiremaker’s lead investor will likely conflict with American rules on connected vehicles, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Issues New Warning Over Italian Tiremaker’s Chinese Owner

author: Alisa Odenheimer
description: The Israel Defense Forces said it conducted a precise strike targeting the senior leadership of the Hamas.
title: Israel Says It Conducted a ‘Precise Strike’ on Hamas Leadership

author: Paul Wallace, Alisa Odenheimer
description: Israel conducted a strike against senior Hamas leaders in the Qatari capital of Doha, escalating an already tense standoff between the country and Arab nations over the war in Gaza.
title: Israel Targets Hamas Leadership in Strikes on Qatari Capital

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Biz Carson
description: Gavin Newsom has embarked on a fight with major stakes for the US government — not to mention his own political future. Standing in his way is a bow-tie-wearing physicist who loves classical Japanese poetry and is heir to a Berkshire Hathaway fortune.
title: A Berkshire Heir Is Spending Millions to Stop Newsom’s Redistricting Plan

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italian officials preparing the government’s budget are assuming as much as €13 billion ($15.3 billion) in extra fiscal space because of lower borrowing costs, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Italy’s Lower Bond Yields Reap €13 Billion Windfall for Meloni

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court is nearing a verdict in the landmark case against Jair Bolsonaro, the first time a former president stands trial on charges of attempting a coup in Latin America’s largest nation.
title: Bolsonaro Coup Trial Resumes as Top Court’s Verdict Nears

author: Jorge Valero
description: European Union officials are trying to work out how to turn their anxiety about an increasingly hostile world into action.
title: Europe’s Crisis of Confidence Heaps Pressure Onto Von Der Leyen

author: Tom Rees, Irina Anghel
description: The former head of Britain’s statistics body said he “regrets” failing to fix a hostile culture within the ailing organization but blamed underfunding for the crisis in the country’s economic data.
title: Ex-UK Stats Chief Regrets Failings, Blames Funding for Data Woes

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves hit back at the opposition Conservative Party for suggesting the UK may need to seek a bailout from the International Monetary Fund, calling the claim “irresponsible.”
title: Reeves Says ‘Not Serious’ to Suggest UK May Need IMF Bailout

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland plans to close its border with Belarus on Friday because of military exercise known as Zapad that the country’s neighbor will start together with Russia later this week, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said in Warsaw on Tuesday.
title: Poland to Close Belarus Border Amid Zapad Military Exercise

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: UK Education Secretary Bridget Phillipson is among at least four MPs seeking to become the Labour Party’s deputy leader, as a scramble for nominations begins in what is set to be a potentially destabilizing process for Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Education Secretary Joins Early Scramble for Labour’s No. 2 Post

author: Vinicius Andrade, Nicolle Yapur
description: It took less than a week — and a landslide defeat for free-market reformer Javier Milei — to make Morgan Stanley abandon its bullish call on Argentina.
title: Morgan Stanley’s Flip-Flop Shows Speed of Crisis Ensnaring Milei

author: Kari Lundgren
description: Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store said the gas-rich nation will continue to hunt for fossil fuels even as parliamentary partners call for a retreat from the sector.
title: Norway’s Premier Holds Fast to Fossil Fuels as Greens Add Seats

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK saw its first beach landing of an unescorted migrant boat in almost three years this weekend, raising fresh questions about Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s campaign to slow a record surge in English Channel crossings.
title: UK Sees First Beach Landing of Small Boat in Almost Three Years

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: A tech association funded by Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc.’s Google and other major tech companies is launching a new initiative to strengthen the frayed relationship between Democrats and Silicon Valley ahead of the 2026 midterm elections.
title: Big Tech Looks to Strengthen Frayed Relationship With Democrats Ahead of Midterms

author: Molly Smith
description: Help is wanted at the Bureau of Labor Statistics — a lot of help.
title: Staffing Crisis Unfolds at BLS With a Third of Leadership Jobs Now Vacant

author: Dan Strumpf
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Asia’s Gen-Z Is Angry and Demanding Change

author: Christoph Rauwald, Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz called for more regulatory flexibility from the European Union, throwing his weight behind the German auto industry’s push to soften rules that would effectively ban combustion engine vehicles in 10 years.
title: Merz Backs Auto Industry’s Push for Looser EU Rules on EV Shift

author: Olesia Safronova
description: At least 20 civilians were killed in a Russian strike on the rural settlement of Yarova in the Donetsk region, Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said in a post on X platform on Tuesday.
title: Zelenskiy Says At Least 20 Killed in Russian Strike on Donetsk Town

author: Swati Gupta
description: Nepal’s Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned after two days of violent protests, according to the Press Trust of India, citing unidentified officials.
title: Nepal Prime Minister Resigns After Deadly Protests, PTI Says

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: France and Germany are urging the European Union to target major Russian oil companies as part of the bloc’s next package of sanctions, according to proposals seen by Bloomberg.
title: France and Germany Lead EU Push to Sanction Russian Oil Majors

author: Frank Jomo
description: Malawian President Lazarus Chakwera apologized for chronic nationwide fuel shortages and accused employees of the state oil company of trying to sabotage his re-election bid ahead of next week’s vote.
title: Malawi President Apologizes for Fuel Shortage Ahead of Election

author: Tugce Ozsoy, Firat Kozok
description: Turkey’s main opposition party is preparing an unusual form of resistance to a court-appointed trustee’s takeover of its Istanbul branch: moving its provincial headquarters to a different district of the city every day.
title: Turkey Opposition Turns Istanbul Headquarters into Moving Target

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul has declared assets worth $124 million that include three private jets, two speed boats and a luxurious property in Bangkok.
title: New Thai Premier Discloses $124 Million Assets Including Jets

author: William Horobin
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is seeking a fifth prime minister in less than two years to tackle the country’s debt problems. Here are some of the leading contenders, categorized by the general approach Macron may take in making his choice.
title: Here Are the Leading Contenders to Be France’s New Premier

author: Greg Ritchie
description: A measure of France’s borrowing costs exceeded Italy’s for the first time in the euro zone’s history, demonstrating how investor concerns over fiscal policy are redrawing the region’s bond markets.
title: French Borrowing Costs Top Italy’s in Historic Market Shift

author: Ethan Bronner, Fares Alghoul
description: Israel ordered Gaza City’s one million residents to leave in advance of a major military offensive, with top officials vowing devastation unless Iran-backed Hamas surrenders.
title: Israel Orders All Gaza City Residents to Leave Ahead of Assault

author: Kateryna Kadabashy
description: The head of the United Nations nuclear watchdog will meet Iran’s top diplomat in Egypt on Tuesday, their first encounter since Israel and the US bombed the Islamic Republic’s key atomic sites in June.
title: UN Nuclear Chief and Iran’s Foreign Minister to Meet in Cairo

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway’s election winner, Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store, is starting negotiations with his political allies to win their backing for a minority cabinet.
title: Norway Premier Starts Talks With Center-Left After Reelection

author: Scott Squires
description: Mexico’s budget includes 263.5 billion pesos ($14.1 billion) for its embattled state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos to cover debt expenses in 2026, the latest in a string of financial lifelines for the debt-ridden driller.
title: Mexico Includes $14 Billion in 2026 Budget to Pay Pemex Debt

author: Maya Averbuch, Alex Vasquez
description: The Mexican government is looking to trim its budget deficit next year compared to this year’s expenditures, according to its official spending blueprint.
title: Mexico Targets Smaller Budget Deficit, More Tax Income in 2026

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: A plan by the Philippine government to purchase US fighter jets is on hold, according to Jose Manuel Romualdez, Manila’s ambassador to Washington.
title: Philippine Plan to Purchase US Figher Jets on Hold, Envoy Says

author: Andreo Calonzo, Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s family gained global notoriety four decades ago for the extensive corruption of his late father’s dictatorship. Now, he’s set in motion an anti-graft drive that could boost his popularity and investor sentiment.
title: Marcos Turns Corruption Buster, Taps Anger Over Philippine Elite

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korea will send a chartered plane to the US on Wednesday to bring home as many as 300 workers detained in a US immigration raid on a Hyundai Motor Co.—LG Energy Solution Ltd. site that’s rocked diplomatic ties.
title: Chartered Jet to Bring Detained Korean Workers Home From US

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: The detention of hundreds of South Koreans in a US immigration raid sent shock waves through the Asian nation and plunged Lee Jae Myung into the biggest diplomatic challenge of his young presidency.
title: Shackled Workers Threaten to Unravel Korea’s Wins With Trump

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: A Thai court ordered former leader Thaksin Shinawatra to serve one year in prison to complete a sentence for a past conviction, the latest setback for the influential politician whose daughter was ousted as prime minister last month.
title: Thai Court Sends Thaksin to One Year in Jail for Dodging Prison

author: Will Mathis, Eamon Farhat
description: The UK is facing mounting political and economic pressure on one of its campaign promises to achieve a clean power grid by 2030.
title: Britain's £240 Billion Green Superpower Plan Faces Crucial Test

author: Philip Aldrick
description: UK pension funds should be proud to declare investments in defense companies because the political climate has changed and reputational risks are diminishing, the chief executive of the state-owned British Business Bank said.
title: UK-Backed Lender Calls on Funds to Champion Defense Investment

author: Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia’s new finance minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa vowed to maintain fiscal discipline even as he hinted he’d allow more state spending than his predecessor.
title: New Indonesia Finance Chief Vows to Maintain Fiscal Discipline

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s ruling party is set to decide when and how an upcoming leadership race will be held, after Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s resignation announcement triggered a vote to choose his successor.
title: Japan’s Ruling Party Reportedly to Set Leadership Race on Oct. 4

author: Samy Adghirni, William Horobin
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will appoint a new prime minister within days, after the current premier lost a confidence vote in the lower house of parliament.
title: Macron Looks for a New Premier Following Bayrou’s Ouster in Vote

author: Denny Thomas, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw a ground test of a high-thrust solid-fuel engine designed for long-range missiles, state media reported, marking another step in its push to further expand its nuclear arsenal.
title: Kim Jong Un Oversees Long-Range Missile Engine Test, KCNA Says

author: Manuela Tobias
description: A humiliating election defeat is forcing Argentine President Javier Milei to face up to a series of political miscalculations — chief among them, his reliance on his beloved sister.
title: Milei’s ‘Boss’ Becomes Liability Ahead of Crucial Argentina Vote

author: Anup Roy, Masaki Kondo
description: India’s central bank steadily reduced its purchases of US Treasuries and increased gold buying even before President Donald Trump slapped the country with punishing tariffs, as the country diversifies away from what was once seen as a safe haven asset.
title: India’s RBI Cut US Debt, Bought Gold Even Before Trump’s Tariffs
